title: M22 graph
summary: The M22 graph, also called the Mesner graph[1][2][3] or Witt graph[4] is the unique strongly regular graph with parameters (77, 16, 0, 4).[5] It is constructed from the Steiner system (3, 6, 22) by representing its 77 blocks as vertices and joining two vertices iff they have no terms in common or by deleting a vertex and its neighbors from the Higmanâ€“Sims graph.[6][7]
